alert.note: Alert for Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 9:30AM CST until January 31 at 9:46PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Brazos River near West Columbia affecting Brazoria County. For the Brazos River...including Bryan, West Columbia, US 59, Sugar Land, TX, Hempstead, Bellville, San Felipe, Richmond, Rosharon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brazos River near West Columbia. * WHEN...From this morning to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as water escapes the mainstem of the Brazos River approximately 6 miles downstream of the gauge. Lowest homes in Bar X are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Saturday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CST Saturday was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Brazos River West Columbi 23.0 23.5 Sat 8 am CST 25.1 25.2 24.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening. late tonight at 330 AM CST.
